revised_title: Inhibition of Paraffin Thermal Decomposition by Nitric Oxide, Propylene, and Iso-Butene
tldr: The authors studied the effect of different inhibitors (nitric oxide, propylene, and iso-butene) on the thermal decomposition of three paraffins (n-pentane, iso-pentane, and iso-butane). They found that all inhibitors reduced the rate of decomposition to a constant limit, suggesting that the residual reaction is a direct molecular decomposition and not an imperfectly suppressed chain reaction.
